results.title: 3rd Ave El = Third Avenue El
results.brief_description: A dizzying, poetic ride through the city on an elevated railway that today exists only in memory. The El was noisy, ponderous and rickety - a leftover from earlier times, but by exploring the train, its passengers, movements, colours and images we find that it had its own unique beauty.

results.title: The Things we want to keep
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Malcolm Otton, Australian Heritage Commission and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Looks at many of Australia’s historic buildings, towns, aboriginal sites, parks, flora and fauna. Shows some of the restoration work that has been done and encourages people to be aware of their heritage and to start thinking about change and the environment.

results.title: The Things people want
results.creator_credit: Jamison Handy and Jam Handy Organization
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how to sell in a competitive market with emphasis on the importance of product knowledge, creating the desire to own, getting the decision to buy and delivery of service or product. Six primary buyer’s interests are listed: comfort, safety, economy, performance, durability and appearance.

results.title: Then one year
results.brief_description:
Deals primarily with physiological changes in boys and girls at the onset of adolescence, and also to some extent with the worries and tensions of that period. Stresses that individual differences are normal variants.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Theirs is the kingdom
results.brief_description: Two high school boys attempting to solve the problems of poverty in a Mexican border town, cause a near riot because of their insensitivity. Back at school one of the boys realises that the whole venture was no more than an ego trip, and tries to escape his feelings by speeding out to the desert on his bike. The bike upsets and he finds himself in the dust, alone unable to take anymore, he cries out to God. Some days later, Carl at peace, is seen alone heading back to spend a few days living among the people in the border town.

results.title: Thank you, from John
results.brief_description: Illustrates the widespread welfare work being carried out by the Save the Children Fund in many countries; activities at the Hopscotch Nursery, London, caring for children whose parents are absent from home during daytime; the work of the Junior Clubs in London; welfare projects in the British Zone in Germany, in the villages of Greece, in Austria, Italy and in many other European countries.

results.title: Terminus
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Impressions by John Schlesinger of a day in one London’s main railway stations - told with music, songs and half-hearted commentary. A historically significant account of Waterloo Station which has altered greatly to accommodate the Channel Tunnel trains. Music by Ron Grains. (Awards: British Film Academy Award - Best Documentary, Venice Golden Lion Awards)
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Schlesinger, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
